error.signature: error: remote rejected: push declined due to repository rule violations

verdict.summary: The remote server rejected the push due to branch protection rules, server-side hooks, or repository policy violations such as unsigned commits, force push restrictions, or required status checks.

dead_ends.action: Force pushing with git push --force to override the rejection
dead_ends.why_fails: Branch protection rules on the remote explicitly block force pushes; the --force flag is rejected by the server-side hook

dead_ends.action: Deleting and recreating the remote branch
dead_ends.why_fails: Branch deletion is typically also blocked by the same protection rules that prevent force pushes

workarounds.action: Push to a feature branch and create a pull request
workarounds.how: Create a new branch: git checkout -b feature/my-change. Push to that branch: git push origin feature/my-change. Then create a PR/MR through the platform UI.

workarounds.action: Ensure commits meet repository requirements (signed, passing checks)
workarounds.how: If commits require signing: git config commit.gpgsign true, then amend or rebase to sign commits. If status checks are required, ensure CI passes on a feature branch first.

leads_to.condition: when the rejected push is retried without addressing the rule violation

preceded_by.condition: when a standard push failure leads users to attempt pushing to protected branches

frequently_confused_with.distinction: remote-rejected is a server-side policy rejection; failed-to-push-some-refs is typically a client-side divergence error requiring pull before push
